title: 104_hr484
content: SECTION 1. INELIGIBILITY OF ALIENS NOT LAWFULLY IN THE UNITED STATES FOR PUBLIC WELFARE ASSISTANCE. Aliens not lawfully in the United States are ineligible for most public welfare assistance programs, except for emergency medical services. The program under title V of the Social Security Act includes various programs such as community health centers, family planning services, migrant health centers, aid to needy families with children, child welfare services, supplemental security income, and foster care and adoption assistance. The programs under part E of title IV of the Social Security Act include the school lunch program, special supplemental food program for women, infants, and children, nutrition programs for older Americans, school breakfast program, child and adult care food program, Emergency Food Assistance Act, and summer food service program for children. The programs covered under part E of title IV of the Social Security Act include the summer food service program for children, commodity supplemental food program, special milk program, rental assistance for low-income families, public housing assistance program, and housing loan program. The programs covered under part E of title IV of the Social Security Act include various housing assistance programs such as interest reduction payments, loans for rental and cooperative housing, rental assistance payments, assistance payments for homeowners, and rent supplement payments for qualified tenants. The Housing and Urban Development Act of 1965 includes loan and grant programs for repairs and improvements to rural dwellings, housing for farm labor, preservation and rehabilitation of housing, mutual and self-help housing, technical assistance, and site loans. The programs established under various parts and subparts of the Higher Education Act of 1965 and the Public Health Service Act. The Public Health Service Act includes programs for loans, scholarships, grants for immunizations, lead poisoning screening, preventive health services, and training for disadvantaged adults. The Job Training Partnership Act includes programs for training disadvantaged adults and youth, Job Corps program, and summer youth employment programs. The programs under various acts include Older American Community Service Employment Act, Older Americans Act of 1965, Domestic Volunteer Service Act of 1973, Low-Income Energy Assistance Act of 1981, Energy Conservation and Production Act, and block grants for social services under title XX of the Social Security Act. The curr_chunk discusses various programs and grants under different acts, including the Community Services Block Grant Act, Legal Services Corporation Act, Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act, Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990, State child care program under the Social Security Act, and State legalization impact-assistance grants under the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986. The Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 requires Federal agencies to notify program beneficiaries of changes in eligibility.
